result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sidney Ann Gresham

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 11/21/22 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Bergner.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 3
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

1:12 PM Defendant Sidney Ann Gresham appeared by video from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.
Atty Mutchler calls the case and states the appearances. 

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of Fleeing and Eluding an Officer.  
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

State is not aware of any juvenile or criminal case for the defendant. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 

BY THE COURT: Initial hearing scheduled.
$1,000 signature bond ordered.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
